lead_paragraph: Nobody knows what Adolf Hitler thought he was starting when he ordered his troops into Poland three years ago today. Nobody knows whether he thought at all. He is a man of instinct and emotion, and maybe these sufficed. He could not have held back indefinitely, even if he had wished to do so.
